Does anyone have advice about starting a listServ. I would like to start a list serv in my State for Advocacy and Mental Health. It seems really hard to find hosting and other for non-profits. Does anyone have any suggestions about running, hosting or starting a list
 
 (I am not reallu into doing a yahoo group, I would like to take a step up from that)

My info may be a little out of date...
 
 http://topica.com/ and AOL both host (or hosted) free listserves. I know that if you previously had a listserve with AOL, it is still active).
 
 Also, you used to be able to operate a listserve from a http://www.freeshell.org/ account. Be advised, though, that the last itme I operated a lsitserv from there, I was sitting in front of an Amstrad 1512 with DUAL 5 1/4 drives, the newest and fastest 2400 baud modem, and my new hard drive held 5 meg and cost $4000. So things may have changed.
 
 Have you contacted your ISP? A lot of ISPs will host your list for free if you lean on them a little. If yyou have some free web space with your account, you can almost certainly host it fromt here.

 I still subscribe to a couple of old lists (keeps the riff raff out), but both are sponsored bandwidth. Seems everything 'free' is now so plastered with ads finding the actual subject matter can be difficult. I pay $3.95/mo for my personal website, that includes 500MB of host space and 25,000MB of monthly bandwidth. I can run anything I want on it. Just a thought.
